abstract: John Roth, Homeland Security inspector general, reports that his department's two-year investigation found no evidence of criminal activity in expedited visas issued by Citizenship and Immigration Services to foreign investors with close ties to prominent Democrats; does find evidence that former agency chief Alejandro Mayorkas worked to create perception that Democrats were receiving special treatment.
lead_paragraph: Though he appeared not to have acted criminally, Alejandro Mayorkas, the department’s deputy secretary, was found to have created a perception of favoritism by expediting visas for well-known Democrats.

headline.main: Homeland Security Official Didn’t Break Law on Visas, Inspector Says
headline.print_headline: No Criminal Conduct Is Found in Visas Expedited by Homeland Security Official

snippet: Though he appeared not to have acted criminally, Alejandro Mayorkas, the department’s deputy secretary, was found to have created a perception of favoritism by expediting visas for well-known Democrats.
